page.title: 19THE RIVER THAMES ,ABINGDON
page.content: The River Thames, flowing roughly North South through Abingdon, has always been a great influence on the town.Abingdon has developed entirly on the West bank,the opposite being liable to flood.As there is only one bridge crossing the river through traffic is funneled in to the centre of the town,resulting in a very busy, but necessary,one way system. The river brings many benefits to the town.Apart from it's beauty, especially where the older buildings meet the river,there is always much to see.Ranging from holiday launches, pleasure boats,yachts,rowers, and canoeists,to fishermen,walkers and swimmers.As a result, the tourist industry is very important to the town.
